title: Microsoft Windows InstallService Hard Link Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to escalate privileges on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the Microsoft Store Install Service. By creating a hard link, an attacker can abuse the service to overwrite the contents of a chosen file. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to escalate privileges and execute code in the context of SYSTEM.
addtionnal_details: Microsoft has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2019-1423
timeline:
2019-08-08 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2019-11-13 - Coordinated public release of advisory
